title: There's a really bad memory leak on the sound channel of the client.
body:
To the point of it eventually lagging out the entire client and sounding like bad 8 bit audio, and then nothingness.

~~If you're using C or C++, please delete and move your pointers to NULL. In that order. It'll do everyone a favor.~~ Eyy, confirmed not this.

replies.body:
The audio channels are implemented in JS using the Web Audio API. I have personally done benchmarks for it, so that it won't have memory leaks. There were a couple about 4-5 months ago, but those were fixed pretty quickly.

Most likely, there is a performance issue somewhere else in the code, but it is bad enough that is stealing cycles from other parts of the app. In your case, audio. We currently have a dedicated team looking exclusively into the performance of the client.

Thank you for your patience, we'll keep working hard on this!

Well, that wasn't expected.

Most often, the sound starts fluctuating and progressively deteriorates -just- after a game ends. I mean just after too, because often I'll keep the window open for chat purposes, and I receive normal dings from message receiving. Maybe look into the code that governs the transition from the "game in progress" lockout mode back to the standard mode. There could be a state change issue that offsets the audio.
